title: Cobain's famous green cardigan goes up for sale
text:
The sweater Kurt Cobain wore for Nirvana's iconic performance on MTV's Unplugged session is up for auction and may fetch as much as $US300,000 ($443,000).

Cobain's cardigan is expected to sell for $US300,000. Julien's Auctions

The vintage green cardigan, unwashed, still marked with cigarette stains and missing a button, was bought by its current owner for $US137,500 four years ago. The unidentified businessman has kept it in acid-free tissue in a safe.

Kurt Cobain performs for MTV's Unplugged in 1994. Hulton Archive

There's been a major increase in the value of Cobain's items in the past two years, according to Darren Julien, president of the auction house handling the sale.

"We advised the client that this is the right time to sell the sweater," Julien said. "The starting bid is $US50,000, and it could sell for double or more than what the client paid for in 2015."
description: Unwashed and complete with cigarette stains, the garment he wore on MTV's Unplugged could fetch more than $400,000.
